See also: praxis

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Ancient Greek πρᾶξις (prâxis).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈpʁaksɪs/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Praxis f (genitive Praxis, plural Praxen)

  1. practice, praxis (opposite of theory)
    In der Praxis kommt das selten vor.
    That rarely ever occurs in practice.
  2. surgery (UK), doctor's office (US) (workplace of a self-employed doctor)
    Mein Zahnarzt hat viele Blumen in der Praxis.
    My dentist has a lot of flowers in his surgery.

Derived terms[edit]

  • praxisfern
  • praxisfremd
  • praxisnah

Further reading[edit]

  • Praxis in Duden online
